title: Conduct Literature Search for Adverse Event
description: A pharmacovigilance scientist must conduct a literature search to identify any published case reports for a specific drug-event combination.

tasks.description: Define the search strategy, including the drug name, event term (e.g., 'myocarditis'), and relevant databases (e.g., PubMed, Embase).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent constructs a clear and comprehensive search query.

tasks.description: Execute the search across the selected literature databases.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent runs the search and retrieves a list of abstracts.

tasks.description: Screen the abstracts for relevance and identify any potential case reports.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent reviews the abstracts and identifies three potentially relevant articles.

tasks.description: For relevant articles, create new cases in the safety database and attach the source publication.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent successfully creates three new cases, populating them with data from the publications.
